message: A trailer for Heart of the Swarm was leaked this weekend.  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eD2NLHp50a0&feature=channel_video_title
i wish i had never seen this...soooo freaking vague...jerks
I think the picture that excites me most is this: http://imgur.com/a/FG2TX#x1zSl

Possible new units alert: The crab walker in the top left of this http://imgur.com/a/FG2TX#TdODd - - - The guy in the forefront here http://imgur.com/a/FG2TX#CEuHV seems less likely, and is also visible in the side of this shot http://imgur.com/a/FG2TX#Z5WIB he's less likely because he's almost certainly a story-only character as seen here http://imgur.com/a/FG2TX#Jfsn6 - - - the creatures in the top right of this picture look like two-legged zerglings http://imgur.com/a/FG2TX#Ynn9Y though I have reservations before guessing that Blizzard would include another small brown unit (hard to distinguish from zerglings at-a-glance).
This is more like it! http://imgur.com/a/FG2TX#hRaoF
I think (actually really really hope) that the leaked trailer is unfinished. It has to be! That's not an advertisement for anything and I defy anyone to tell me they got excited from watching it.
As long as the levels are hard and varied enough to reward remaking Kerrigan between missions, I could see playing dress-up with her powers being really fun.
Also the Zergling upgrades (spawn 3 instead of 2, spawn 2 broodlings on death, and instant-hatching) all look reeeeeally fun and I hope at least one bleeds over into multiplayer.
the zerglings look different for some reason...maybe theyre evolved in some way
those pictures are much more intriguing than the trailer...the ign preview is quite nice as well
AND they used the OLD zerg music in the background...ign knows what is up :)

I like the possible new baneling ability to split into two smaller banes instead of blasting after death. Terrans all over the world would cry if this leaked into multiplayer (which it won't but a girl can dream).
I don't think Protosses would sob any less: THREE tank/colossus shots to finally get rid of a Baneling? Never!
